main_definition: An act of making something longer or adding to it; in idioms, can also imply additional support, aid, or delay.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Increasing the length or duration of time
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher granted an extension on the assignment deadline.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Additional support or help offered to someone
meanings_and_examples.example: When she was feeling ill, her friend came over for some emotional and physical extension.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A delay in the execution of a task or agreement
meanings_and_examples.example: The client requested an extension on the payment deadline due to financial difficulties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An additional feature added to a product or service
meanings_and_examples.example: The smartphone comes with various extensions, such as wireless charging and waterproof casing.
